long: Meaning: to "be" (causatively "make") "large" (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride).  Usage: advance, boast, bring up, exceed, excellent, be(-come, do, give, make, wax), great(-er, come to... estate,   things), grow(up), increase, lift up, magnify(-ifical), be much set by, nourish (up), pass, promote, proudly (spoken), tower.  Source: a primitive root; properly, to twist (compare "H1434"), i.e.
